intro: Browallia albiantha, commonly known as the white browallia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Its flowers are predominantly white or pale blue, with a distinctive yellow throat. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in coastal climates.
